subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|さび|yomi=k}}
Origins unclear. Possibly related to {{m|ja|錆|tr=sabi||rust, oxidation}}, from the way the surface of something changes.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|さび}}

# a [[pattern]] of [[crack]]s and [[wrinkle]]s on the [[surface]] of an {{m|ja|烏帽子|tr=eboshi||traditional Japanese formal black hat}} formed as the black [[lacquer]] dries

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|しぼ|yomi=k}}
Probably from stem ''shiwo'' of classical verb ''shiworu'', modern ''shioru'' ({{l|ja|萎る}}, {{l|ja|撓る}}: “to make something loosen, to make something wither and wrinkle”). Probably cognate with ''shiwa'' below.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|しぼ}}

# a [[pattern]] of [[crack]]s and [[wrinkle]]s on the [[surface]] of an {{m|ja|烏帽子|tr=eboshi||traditional Japanese formal black hat}} formed as the black [[lacquer]] dries
# a pattern of [[pucker]]s and [[bulge]]s in a cloth, caused by the [[warp]] and [[woof]] of the material
# a similar pattern of puckers and bulges formed on the surface of [[paper]] or [[leather]]

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|しわ|yomi=k}}
Probably from stem ''shiwa'' of verb ''shiwaru'' ({{l|ja|撓る}}: “to sag, as something elastic that has lost its bounce”). Probably cognate with ''shibo'' above.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|しわ}}

# [[wrinkle]]s in [[skin]], [[paper]], [[cloth]], or some other surface
# [[ripple]]s on the [[surface]] of [[water]]
# a [[pattern]] of [[crack]]s and [[wrinkle]]s on the [[surface]] of an {{m|ja|烏帽子|tr=eboshi||traditional Japanese formal black hat}} formed as the black [[lacquer]] dries
